subtitle: The mustard pastry base makes this spicy quiche even more flavoursome.

method.text: Sift the flour and salt into a bowl. Rub in the butter until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Stir in the mustard. Add enough cold water to form a soft dough.
Turn the dough out on a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Roll out and use to line a 20 cm round fluted flan case. Prick the base with a fork. Chill for 20 min.
Line the pastry case with greaseproof paper. Fill with baking beans. Bake for 10 min. Remove the paper and beans and cook for about 5 min until firm.
Heat the oil in a frying pan. Add the onion, garlic and chilli powder and fry for 2 min until softened. Add the beef to the pan and fry for 3-5 min until browned.
Remove from heat and stir in the tomato puree, tomatoes, beans and seasoning. Leave to cool slightly.
Beat the eggs in a jug, and stir into the filling mixture. Pour into the pastry case and smooth over the surface.
Place the flan tin on a baking tray and bake in the oven for 25 min, or until firm.
Serve hot or cold, in slices.

title: Spiced beef and bean quiche
